statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Marcus Gilbert scored 27 points with four clutch free throws at the end of overtime to lift Fairfield past Loyola (MD) 94-88 Tuesday night.
article.headline: Fairfield uses late rally to defeat Loyola (MD) 94-88 in OT
article.linkText: Fairfield uses late rally to defeat Loyola (MD) 94-88 in OT
article.story: FAIRFIELD, Conn. -- Marcus Gilbert scored 27 points with four clutch free throws at the end of overtime to lift Fairfield past Loyola (MD) 94-88 Tuesday night. Trailing 68-59 with 6:21 to play in regulation, Gilbert scored 10 of the Stags' 19 points down the stretch. His 3-point play with 14 seconds left tied the game at 78 to force the extra session. Tyler Nelson hit a 3 off a feed from Gilbert to put Fairfield up 90-86 in with 36 seconds left in overtime. Gilbert then went 4-for-4 from the free-throw line to seal the win. Gilbert finished 10 for 11 from the free-throw line. Tyler Hubbard's 3 gave the Greyhounds a 59-46 lead with 13:05 remaining before the Stags started their furious rally. Nelson finished with 19 points and Jerry Johnson Jr., added 13 off the bench for Fairfield (5-5). Chancellor Barnard led Loyola (1-9) with 17 points and Jared Jones and Cam Gregory each had 14.
